channel.title: CVE Feed for IBM -- Rational Collaborative Lifecycle Management
channel.description: The latest CVEs for IBM -- Rational Collaborative Lifecycle Management

item.title: CVE-2021-29713|2024-08-03T22:18:02.516Z -- ibm -- rational%20collaborative%20lifecycle%20management
item.description: IBM Jazz Team Server products are vulnerable to cross-site scripting. This vulnerability allows users to embed arbitrary JavaScript code in the Web UI thus altering the intended functionality potentially leading to credentials disclosure within a trusted session.

item.title: CVE-2021-20371|2024-08-03T17:37:24.118Z -- ibm -- rational%20collaborative%20lifecycle%20management
item.description: IBM Jazz Foundation and IBM Engineering products could allow a remote attacker to obtain sensitive information when an error message is returned in the browser. This information could be used in further attacks against the system. IBM X-Force ID: 195516.

item.title: CVE-2021-20346|2024-08-03T17:37:23.810Z -- ibm -- rational%20collaborative%20lifecycle%20management
item.description: IBM Jazz Foundation and IBM Engineering products are vulnerable to server-side request forgery (SSRF). This may allow an authenticated attacker to send unauthorized requests from the system, potentially leading to network enumeration or facilitating other attacks. IBM X-Force ID: 194595.

item.title: CVE-2021-29774|2024-08-03T22:18:02.992Z -- ibm -- rational%20collaborative%20lifecycle%20management
item.description: IBM Jazz Team Server products could allow an authenticated user to obtain elevated privileges under certain configurations. IBM X-Force ID: 203025.
